messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 69 years old, male, of White descent. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of less than $20,000. English is their first language. They are 31.0 feet tall and weighs 164 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have a graduate degree. Although I have never had any medical training, I am familiar with the meanings of many medical terms. I have also studied Latin, and learned the Latin derivation of many terms. I once volunteered in a medical clinic, and learned terminology from a doctor there. He encourage me to go to medical school.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have certain things in common with my primary care physician. He routinely vacations in an area I am familiar with. My doctor speaks English, and there are no cultural barriers between us. He has a good sense of humor and is, generally speaking, a very nice man. I like him as a person, and I trust his judgment.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Mostly, it is the fear of the unknown. I have high blood sugar, and I am always concerned that my doctor might tell me that I am a diabetic. That would be very traumatic for me. This relates to my weight, and I worry what my doctor's scale will show for that.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I had never had a urinary tract infection, but I began having unusual symptoms on urination. When I went to the doctor, I suspected that he might test my urine for evidence of infection. He did.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $35,000 - $54,999. English is their first language. They are 30.0 feet tall and weighs 147 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel like I am very capable of abtaining and filling out medical forms and documents.I understand the basic health information I am given and the services I am provided. I can make appropriate health decisions. If needed I can find the help I need.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my physican because of the help and treatment I have received has helped greatly. I have a better healthier life.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I have no anxiety or worries only of the bill. My doctor is completely capable. I am very relaxed and know with my doctor I can handle anything.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I can only think of diets, reading labels weighing in .Seeing the doctor. Taking medicine. I knew how to take care of myself.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $55,000 - $74,999. English is their first language. They are 33.0 feet tall and weighs 260 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I understand what I am told by medical officials. If I have a problem I ask questions immediately to make sure I understand everything before leaving the office. I Iunderstand basic health information and services that are needed to treat me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor is easy to talk to and I can discuss all medical problems. He immediately explains to me what I can do about my medical problems and suggests simple things that may help me. I can call with a medical problem and will receive answer before 5pm.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

What foods I must stop eating. I have new health problems related/caused by my current digestive problems. I hate the word tests, prep for the tests, actually taking the test and hearing my health problems are causing me more problems.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Discovering that I have digestive disorder. Several possibles were given to me as what type of disease I was not surprise because I had been reading information online and knew which one I had but again tests were made and I was right.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think i can do most myself with some help from the doctor or online. I have no issue understanding what is required of me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust them, it's there job to make sure people like me are OK. I'm sure you don't go to school for 10 years and not learn anything there.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Bad news, nobody ever wants to hear some bad news when they visit the office. The wainting period leaves some anxious as well.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I've never had to go out of way to render aid to someone physically or vocally using medical advice.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am fairly confident in my ability to understand basic health information and make appropriate health decisions for not only myself but also for my son.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have never been given a reason to not trust my doctor and he always seems to take precautions even when he believes everything is ok.  This makes me feel better because he is not just going off of book knowledge and things he's seen in other cases.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
That not only will something be wrong but something that I didn't even predict would be wrong as well.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Having a child allows me a lot of opportunities to demonstrate my knowledge of health and medical issues.  When a child cannot talk you have to go strictly off of exhibited symptoms and medical knowledge.  I have had to determine if his discontent was irritation, hunger, or illness.

I think I am able to obtain, process and understand any basic health information needed to make health decisions. I have enough background to understand this kind of information.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I am not sure he takes the time to understand everything is happening to me. Sometimes I think his time is much more valuable than my health.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I do not feel comfortable going to the doctor's office. Health issues make me feel tense and anxious. I am not sure about the reason. Probably is the possibility of finding something new about my health.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I usually research in internet when I find a health problem. After that I go to the doctor's office. Most of the times my research has given the correct result.

to a very high degree, i am educated enough to understand them. besides i ask my doctor to tell me every single detail so i would be able to understand the whole situation.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
of course i trust my doctor i have chosen him  because of his good fame and he always give me the right treatment.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
nothing at all, i am always relaxed , there is nothing to be afraid of, besides i trust my doctor very much.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
it is a high level experience, i have a good knowledge, i know who is the best doctor to see when i am sick.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 60 years old, female, of White descent. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is their first language. They are 29.0 feet tall and weighs 212 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel like I am pretty informed and do ask questions about health care options. There are times that my doctor is uble or unwilling to address certain questions (i.e. supplements versus prescription meds; treatment side effects, etc.) and questions go unswered.  But I generally understand information I am given or I am able to find competent online sources to read further and understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I believe my doctor is competent and concerned. He is  nearing retirement himself and is pretty conventiol in his thinking. Old school is his approach and he doesn't stretch his thinking to consider newer treatment options. I think there is some value in looking at treatments like acupuncture, pain magement techniques beyond meds and holistic treatments. He pooh-poohs such ideas and finds fault with altertive practitioners. So I believe he has my best interest at heart but I think he stopped expanding his views on what options might be.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I worry that the doctor will find a health problem I am not already aware of. I worry that the doctor will get short if I ask too many questions. I worry that the doctor is so attuned to conventiol options that he won't think broadly about new possibilities to address conditions with less side effects and more benefits.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I recently learned I have the MTHFR genetic defect from both parents (homozygous). I researched the genetic mutation issue and came to understand that my body does not "methylize" properly. In particular, my ability to convert folate to a useble form is compromised by about 70%. This has an effect on the efficiency of many methylation and detox pathways in my body. This also means I am more suspectible to certain health issues (fertility issues, depression, heart and vascular disease, Parkinson's). Some experts believe there are dietary and nutritiol options that can help to offset some of the effects of the "mutation." I am pretty well versed in what they are at this point.

In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
nothing make me most anxious or worried when I visit the doctor's office.  I go to get well and the doctor is the person the I respect and seek answers.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have knowledge of heath and appreciate a doctor's input on correcting the problems and issue to make my health better.

I have no problems understanding basic health information.  If I do not fully understand something related to my health, I can either get an explation from my medical providers or do some basic research on my own until I understand the issue.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I have had a long doctor/patient relationship with her and she always remembers the different reasons for which I have seen her and follows up.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I get anxious about my lab results for my condition and also about my weight.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When my children have fevers I give them tylenol and make them rest and check their temperature often to see if we need to go to the pediatrician.

I understand all the forms that I am given t read and fill out , I speak , read and write  English quite well
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
has always been to the point and forth rite in dealing with me in all of my health concerns even now that I have a rare terminal condition
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
where might my blood pressure be. I do have some white coat tension when they measure that the first time but then when they measure it a few minutes later it is much better
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

over the last seventeen years of being treated for CHF and Arterial Stenosis , have had many experimental medications and other treatments. so far after being diagnosed with a 3 to 5 year life span with this condition have now survived 17 years

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 53 years old, female, of White descent. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is their first language. They are 32.0 feet tall and weighs 155 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think that I am generally well equipped to handle the information I am provided. I have solid reading skills, but my greatest strength is in my ability to ask questions. I am good at asking for information and paraphrasing what the physician says. My biggest complaint with my previous doctor is that he was in and out of the office so fast that it did not give me time to process information and formulate questions. My current doctor is much better about that and is excellent at communicating information.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think my doctor does an excellent job of listening to me and following up.  I went in describing symptoms that I did not think added up to anything. She immediately ordered bloodwork for me and we learned that I have hypothyroidism. My doctor appears to really pay attention and I trust that she is working toward my best interests.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

My doctor does my "well woman" exams. I don't think that any woman is entirely comfortable with that. My doctor has a good personal manner of dealing with people, though.  I think any time that I put on a gown with no back on it and nothing underneath, I am not going to be at my most confident.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I'm afraid that most of my health knowledge comes from Google. I can recall that I once wanted someone to eat papaya seeds when they had an upset stomach. People thought I was crazy.  I lived in Hawaii and took a chemistry class in high school. I learned that there is apparently an enzyme that is highly concentrated in papaya seeds that is good for an upset stomach.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I can fully understand anything and what I don't understand I research online.  I can comprehend very well and I am very well educated and I asks a lot of questions when I'm concerned about something.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctors are great and listens sometimes, but sometime looks over some of the problems I am experiences.  I have been having a shooting pain in my foot and all she says is its your nerve but haven't checked it out.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I go into my doctor's appointments with faith in God and prays for the best outcome.  When I've been having troubles and have some tests done I tend to stress over the outcome, but I pray about it and leave it in the hand of our Savior.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have had many health issues.  Two months ago I had a Para-esophageal hernia repair, which was successful.  I was having constant heartburn, shortness of breath, plus numerous of other issues.  Since my surgery my health is improving, but I am dealing with a lot of fatigue.  My health issues have given me the opportunity to research into my health problems more thoroughly and learn about my body.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 48 years old, female, of White descent. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $90,000 or more. English is their first language. They are 36.0 feet tall and weighs 180 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I have a good ability to process basic health information.  I'm also nit afraid to ask questions if I don't understand.  I'm very comfortable with my current health provider and she is very patient when it comes to answering my questions.  I also think that I can do research online and fill in any gaps I might have.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

She listens to what I have to say and asks questions rather than jump to conclusions.  She also checks up with me yo see if the treatment we decided on us working or not, or hiw a consult with another doctor went.  She has never been dismissive of any issue I've gone to her with.  I feel that she honestly cares for my health.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I think I'm more anxious about not finding the cause for my pain or injury.  There is nothing more discouraging than being shuffled between doctors who say there us nothing wrong with you based on their specialty and sending you to the next doctor.  In the meantime, the condition worsens, and you can either become so discouraged that  you give up going to the doctor and try to self medicate, or you lie and say you're cured.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I think I can only relate to my own body in these terms.  For example, I suffer from migraines and I know what specific things can trigger one, or what I can do to help mitigate the onset of a migraine before I need medication.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I know i have the capacity. I have been caretaker to an elderly parent in the past and well informed with hospitals, doctors, and many medical procedures.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust the physicans i currently have because i have had positive experiences through the many years that i've been a loyal patient. And when issues arise they are always handled quickly and efficiently.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I feel anxious because offices are usually cold and the exam room can be initimadating. It would be nice if the exam rooms where more cozy and you didn't have to wait so long before you see the doctor and freeze half to death. I also hate when i have to pay out of pocket after the appointment and wasn't told beforehand what to expect to pay so that i'm not caught off guard.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was diagnosed with a hiatal hernia and was given 4 different medications to take by the gastronterologist. I was given a list of foods and other things that could aggravate the hernia and cause the acid refulx to worsen. I cut out all of the foods on the list as well as the smoking and i haven't had any concern in the past year with this issue.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel that I am quite capable of understanding health information given to me by health professionals. I have not had any condition or conditions explained to me that I did not understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because he is honest with me and answers all my concerns. I feel confident that he has my own best interest whenever I visit his office. He is suggestive and offers advice to help me maintain a healthy lifestyle.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I don't have feelings of anxiety when I visit my doctor's office. Since I maintain a healthy lifestyle, I feel very comfortable when visiting his office. I go for regular checkups and I have no need to be worried.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Last year I had to be retested for my mammogram. I didn't get upset, I just scheduled the second test. I figured that they saw something and they wanted to be as accurate as possible. The second test showed nothing.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am knowledgeable enough to read and understand health information, or at the very least ask relevant questions to better understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

They have a good reputation and I have never seen/had anything major to complain about. They have in the past referred me to a specialist whom they thought was better rather pretend to have superior expertise.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am growing older and always fear that something new may be revealed. I also have a breast tumor which always worries me although it has remained 'harmless' for over 20 years.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have an 8 year old who was has had many medical issues since birth. He was in the NICU for almost 4 months after birth. During his stay in hospital, he underwent tons of medical procedures and surgeries. As a responsible parent, I had to educate myself about the issues, terms, diagnoses, medications in order to understand and communicate with his doctors and carers. In addition, I needed as much knowledge as possible to take care of him at home. Thankfully, he is now doing well - fewer doctor visits and therapies and am even thinking of going back to work - if I can get a job :-)

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 26 years old, male, of White descent. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of less than $20,000. English is their first language. They are 38.0 feet tall and weighs 160 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think I have a pretty good idea about it, but with the issue of insurance, it makes the whole process a lot more harrowing. I understand what doctors tell me and have a general idea of what to fill out on health forms, but there are times when that intersects with insurance and I'm at a complete loss
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think it depends on the type of doctor, but on the whole, I trust doctors to prescribe medications and diagnose, but I also trust my own feelings about my body and what I need. So I usually pit the two against each other.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I don't like waiting to see the doctor, and I don't like the small talk aspect of doctors in their offices. I just want a diagnosis, prescription, and to get out. I respect the medical profession but being in a waiting room full of sick people really makes me not want to go to the doctor at all.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I can't think of a specific experience off the top of my head, but when I was seeing my psychiatrist, he often tried putting me on anti-depressants I knew wouldnt work because we had disagreements about my symptoms. After several months, he realized I was right.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 33 years old, male, of White descent. They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is their first language. They are 36.0 feet tall and weighs 140 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel that after having spoken with my doctor and reviewed any materials provided to me I have the capacity to fully understand health information and make informed and appropriate decisions.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because she goes the extra mile and has ordered tests be done just to be sure of something she thought. She has passion for what she does and has my health and well being as her top priority.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Being in good health and being able to maintain good health. Not wanting to have any issues with my blood work or health.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Recently when my mother was in the hospital I had to explain her condition and the fact that she had MS to doctors and nurses.

They have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $90,000 or more. English is their first language. They are 30.0 feet tall and weighs 140 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I am able to obtain, process and understand basic health information which is explained by my doctor or in basic medical reports.  I am unable to understand test results that have shorthand, acronyms etc. that are specific to the medical field.  I do, however ask my doctor to explain any test results or language that I do not undferstand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care physician is good and better than most.  I believe that, in general doctors have become salesmen.  They are very quick to prescribe medication and refer patients to doctors to patients who refer patients to them.  I do not feel that anyone should completely that in these days of greed and avarice, no one should blindly entrust his/her healthcare to another human being.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am always afraid that my doctor will find an ailment or serious illness. These worries are exacerbated by the fact that that I am a 65 year old cancer survivor and cancer medication is notorious for causing side effects.  For a while, seemingly, my doctor found some health problem with most visits.  This has made me a little anxious about test results and examinations.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Breast cancer taught me how little I know about the cancer and its treatments.  I did a lot of research and discovered that there are many treatments and some unscrupulous doctors who will perform unnecessary treatment for financial gain.  This was a rude awakening and I learned from this that my health is my responsibility and that I should be proactive in obtaining information about my medications and conditions.
